channel.title: CyberNetSec - Industrial Control Systems
channel.description: Latest industrial control systems threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Canada Issues National Alert as Hacktivists Target Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
The Canadian Centre for Cyber Security, along with the RCMP, has issued a national alert warning of increasing cyberattacks by hacktivists against the nation's critical infrastructure. The advisory follows multiple successful breaches of internet-accessible Industrial Control Systems (ICS) in sector...

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Policy and Compliance, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Everest Ransomware Hits Swedish Power Grid Operator, Steals 280GB of Data
item.description:
Sweden's national electricity operator, Svenska kraftnät, has confirmed a data breach following a claim by the Everest ransomware group. The attackers alleged on their dark web leak site that they had stolen 280 GB of internal data. Svenska kraftnät stated that the attack was confined to an external...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Warns of Critical Flaws in Global Fuel Gauge Systems, Risking Infrastructure Disruption
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has issued a critical advisory for two vulnerabilities in Veeder-Root's TLS4B Automatic Tank Gauge (ATG) systems, which are used globally to monitor fuel levels. The most severe flaw, CVE-2025-58428, has a CVSS score of 9.9 and could a...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Patch Management

item.title: U.S. Coast Guard Poised for 'Generational Change' in Maritime Cybersecurity with $25B Funding
item.description:
The U.S. Coast Guard (USCG) is set for a 'generational change' in maritime cybersecurity, according to an analysis by the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS). Nearly $25 billion in new funding, combined with expanded regulatory authorities, will allow the USCG to comprehensively mo...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: DDoS Attack on Russian Food Agency Cripples National Supply Chains
item.description:
Russia's federal agency for veterinary and phytosanitary surveillance, Rosselkhoznadzor, has been targeted by a large-scale distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack starting October 22, 2025. The attack crippled the agency's critical electronic certification systems, including the 'Mercury' platf...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems, Policy and Compliance

item.title: Nation-State and Financial Cybercrime Blur as Industrial Sector Becomes Top Target
item.description:
A new report from Trellix reveals a significant convergence between the tactics of nation-state actors and financially motivated cybercriminals, with both increasingly leveraging AI-powered tools. The industrial sector has emerged as the most targeted industry, accounting for over 36% of attacks ana...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Threat Actor, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: Agenda Ransomware Evolves, Hits Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
The Agenda ransomware group, also known as Qilin, is escalating its attacks by targeting critical infrastructure sectors with evolved tactics. According to research from Trend Micro, the ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) operation is using a cross-platform approach, abusing legitimate remote management...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: Anubis Ransomware Hits Australian Engineering Firm Aussie Fluid Power
item.description:
The Australian industrial engineering company, Aussie Fluid Power, has confirmed it was hit by a ransomware attack claimed by the emerging 'Anubis' ransomware group. The incident, which has impacted company operations and stakeholder data, aligns with warnings from the Australian Cyber Security Cent...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Industrial Control Systems, Cyberattack

item.title: CISA Issues 13 Advisories for Critical ICS/OT Vulnerabilities
item.description:
On October 16, 2025, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) released a significant batch of thirteen advisories for vulnerabilities affecting Industrial Control Systems (ICS). These alerts impact widely used Operational Technology (OT) products from major vendors including ...

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Patch Management

item.title: Full Industrial Control: Two CVSS 10.0 Flaws Found in Red Lion ICS RTUs
item.description:
Security researchers have discovered and disclosed two critical vulnerabilities, both rated CVSS 10.0, in Red Lion Sixnet series industrial remote terminal units (RTUs). The flaws, CVE-2023-42770 (authentication bypass) and CVE-2023-40151 (remote code execution), can be chained together. An unauthen...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Cyberattack
